DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To determine whether early administration albumin expander antioxidant would improve survival 28th day septic shock patient . Design : Prospective , multicenter , randomize , control versus saline , stratify nosocomial infection center . Setting : 27 Intensive Care Units ( ICU ) France Coordinator : Pr J.P. Mira Dr J. Charpentier - Cochin Hospital- Paris Patients : 800 patient could include first 6 hour septic shock .
DOC.brief_title: Early Albumin Resuscitation During Septic Shock
DOC.detailed_description: The primary outcome : Mortality 28 day period randomization . The secondary outcome : Evaluation SOFA score , ventilator-free day , dialysis free day , catecholamine free day , day hospitalisation , incidence nosocomial infection . The albuminemia patient request treatment Day 4 post treatment . The treatment : Vialebex 20 % 100ml every 8 hour 3 day versus saline 100ml every 8 hour 3 day . The first patient July 2006 , last patient expect July 2009 .
